business.headline: Will bears dominate stock market next week? 5 things investors should knowCorporate earnings and key economic data from around the world will likely shape the direction of the stock market, keeping investors on their toes.

Budget 2025: 5 top middle-class expectations for tax relief and savings growthExperts suggest scrapping the old tax regime and rationalising the income tax slabs under the new regime, would go a long way in making income tax simpler.

8th Pay Commission may give a 186% boost to pensions. Find out how The fitment factor plays an important role in calculating the updated pay and benefits and is likely to be in the range between 2.28 and 2.86 for the 8th Pay Commission.

Stuck in middle-income trap: Fareed Zakaria decodes China's economic crisisFareed Zakaria said that China's economy is not going to grow any time at the six, seven, eight percent that it was growing at previously.
How to achieve minimum credit score for getting personal loan? Details hereThe higher the credit score, the greater are the chances for the approval of your loan requests.

InterGlobe Aviation Q3 results: IndiGo operator's net profit falls by 18%Indigo Q3 results: The net profit for the aviation company dropped by 18% to Rs 2,449 crore when compared to Rs 2,998 crore in the same quarter a year ago.

Budget 2025: EV sector pushes for tech investments and smart mobility solutionsExperts anticipate that Budget 2025 would introduce policies that would boost EV sales across the country and help India achieve its goal of reducing carbon emissions by one billion tonnes by 2030.

Sensex, Nifty fall amid volatility; energy and pharma lead lossesShare Market: The S&P BSE Sensex shed 329.92 points to close at 76,190.46, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 113.15 points to end at 23,092.20.
Amul cuts milk prices by Re 1 per litre across IndiaThe reduction will only be applicable to 1-litre packs. Previously, in June 2024, Amul had increased milk prices by Rs 2 per litre.

India-US relationship beyond personalities: Fareed Zakaria on Trump 2.0Fareed Zakaria shared his insights on the political shift in the United States and the seismic changes it is expected to bring geopolitically and economically across the world.

Adani Green Energy shares fall as Sri Lanka cancels power purchase dealAdani Green Energy shares fell after the news of Sri Lanka cancelling the power purchase deal to hit the day's low of Rs 1,008, crashing over 6% from the day's high.

Tata Electronics buys 60% controlling stake in Pegatron IndiaTEPL, which is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Tata Sons, said the latest acquisition aligns with Tata Sons' Chairman N Chandrasekaran's vision of investments by the Tata Group in electronics manufacturing.

Why are markets volatile, and should you be worried? 3 things to know Sensex scaled to 76,985.95, reaching the day's high, a jump of over 500 points, but was trading at 76,621.03 as of 1 PM. Nifty has also gone about in the same manner.

Paytm denies ED probe in crypto scam, calls reports 'factually incorrect'Paytm Latest News: Paytm's clarification came after a few media reports claimed that the ED is investigating the fintech firm and other payment gateways in a cryptocurrency scam.

Explained: Why Paytm share price tumbled nearly 9% todayPaytm share price: The shares of the company fell nearly 9% to hit a day's low of Rs 773.90. At 12:18 pm, shares of the fintech company stabilised a bit to trade 2.27% higher at Rs 829.70.
Why did Cyient CEO Karthikeyan Natarajan resign?The resignation of Cyient's CEO Karthikeyan Natarajan was a major reason that led to the sharp decline in the company's share price.

HUL to acquire stake in Minimalist for Rs 2,670 crore; Peak XV bags 10X gainsHUL has acquired a 90.5% stake in Minimalist for Rs 2,670 crore, making it one of the biggest acquisitions in the country's startup ecosystem.

Cyient share price falls 20% to hit 52-week low. What triggered Friday's crash?Cyient stock price: At around 10:21 am, shares of Cyient were down 17.96% to Rs 1,438 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). In early trade, shares of the IT company fell as much as 20% to hit a 52-week low of Rs 1,402.25.

Explained: Why Dr Reddy's share price cracked 6% in early tradeDr Reddy's Laboratories Stock Price: Dr Reddy's shares tumbled up to 6% in early trade and at 9:46 am, they were trading 4.35% lower at Rs 1,233.25 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

entertainment.headline: He shaved his head when I did: Hina Khan's moving note for boyfriend RockyActor Hina Khan shared a heartfelt note on Instagram, praising her boyfriend Rocky Jaiswal for his unwavering support during her cancer battle.
Watch: Coldplay lead vocalist Chris Martin greets Ahmedabad fans in GujaratiSinger Chris Martin of Coldplay surprised Ahmedabad fans by greeting them in Gujarati during their Ahmedabad concert.

Stranger Things 5 out in November? Eagle-eyed fans spot release dateStranger Things fans may have discovered the release date for the fifth season through a Netflix code. The show will reportedly be released in November 2025.

Storyteller trailer: Paresh Rawal, Adil Hussain shine in Satyajit Ray's short storyThe trailer for The Storyteller starring Paresh Rawal and Adil Hussain has been released. The film brings emotional complexity to Satyajit Ray's classic short story Golpo Boliye Tarini Khuro.

Guru Randhawa visits Maha Kumbh: Blessed to take a sacred dip in Maa GangaSinger Guru Randhawa visited the Maha Kumbh Mela 2025 in Prayagraj and took a sacred dip in the Ganga. He wrote about starting a new journey.

Suits LA trailer: Stephen Amell takes you to 'west coast', Harvey Spector reappearsThe trailer of Suits LA teased actor Gabriel Macht's return as Harvey Spector in the new spin-off series. Actor Stephen Amell leads the show, which is going to be premiered next month.

Coldplay's Chris Martin enjoys scooter ride in Ahmedabad ahead of concertColdplay's Chris Martin made a memorable entrance in Ahmedabad by arriving on a scooter. The iconic rock band is scheduled to perform at the Narendra Modi Stadium on January 25 and 26.

Identity OTT release: When and where to watch Tovino Thomas, Trisha's thrillerIdentity OTT release date: The Tovino Thomas and Trisha Krishnan-starrer is set to release on Zee5. Directed by Akhil Paul and Anas Khan, the psychological thriller will begin streaming from next week.

Coldplay in India: A rollercoaster of excitement, chaos, and disappointmentColdplay's first three concerts in India have left fans with mixed feelings. While tickets for all the five shows sold out quickly, fans all over the country complained about the issues surrounding the Mumbai concerts.

OTT releases of the week: Hisaab Barabar, Sweet Dreams, Sivarapalli and moreWith the weekend around the corner, here's a list of all the latest films and series that will release on OTT this week. Take a look at some here.

Benedict Cumberbatch says it will take 'lot of money' to return as SherlockBritish star Benedict Cumberbatch recently opened up about whether he would return as Sherlock Holmes. The actor played the famed fictional detective in the BBC series.
TV newsmakers of the weekStarting from Karan Veer Merhra's Bigg Boss 18 win to Bal Veer actor's engagement, the television world was full of exciting news and events. Read to know more.
Singer Chris Brown sues Warner Bros for sexual assault allegations in docuseriesSinger Chris Brown has reportedly sued Warner Bros over sexual assault allegations for a whopping $500 million.

Newtopia trailer: BLACKPINK's Jisoo to headline hilarious romantic zombie dramaThe much-anticipated trailer for Newtopia is out, featuring BLACKPINK's Jisoo and actor Park Jeong-min. The duo navigates a zombie outbreak in this gripping drama based on Han Sang-woon's novel Influenza.

Sweet Dreams movie review: Mithila-Amol's film is a candy that's not sweet enoughReleased-Fri Jan 24, 2025Sweet Dreams movie review: Sweet Dreams could have been a simple romantic film, but it ends up being preachy in an attempt to mildly school the young generation about the difference between dreams and reality. However, Mithila Palkar and Amol Parashar look pretty together.

BB 18 winner Karan Veer Mehra's ex-wife, actor Nidhi Seth gets marriedTwo years after separating from Karanveer Mehra, actress Nidhi Seth remarried her boyfriend Sandiip Kummar. Recently, she shared pictures from her temple wedding.

Watch: BTS' J-hope, Rose, G-Dragon and Taeyang claim the stage at Paris eventBTS member J-hope, Blackpink's Rose, and G-Dragon and Taeyang of BigBang recently marked their presence at a Paris event. J-hope even shared photos from his performance on social media.

When Life Gives You Tangerines: Park Bo-gum, IU's K-drama to premiere on this dateThe much-anticipated K-drama, When Life Gives You Tangerines, starring Park Bo-gum and IU, will premiere on Netflix on March 7. The streaming date was shared alongside the show's first teaser.

Hisaab Barabar review: R Madhavan tries hard to save this middling filmReleased-Fri Jan 24, 2025Hisaab Barabar movie review: R Madhavan's latest, Hisaab Barabar, had the potential to deliver something raw and novel. Instead, the Ashwni Dhir directorial falls into the usual traps of the everyman story. Read our take on the film here.

Paatal Lok 2 ending explained: What's next for Hathi Ram, did he get Rs 2 crore?Paatal Lok 2 continues to captivate audiences with its intricate storyline and profound depiction of Nagaland's socio-political landscape. The series resolves its many mysteries, leaving viewers pondering Inspector Hathi Ram's future. Find out what the season's ending meant and whether there will be a third season of Paatal Lok.

general news.headline: Republic Day parade: 'Nari shakti', military firepower on display at Kartavya Path Live UpdatesRepublic Day celebrations, led by President Droupadi Murmu, are underway with tens of thousands attending the grand parade at Kartavya Path. Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto is the chief guest this year.

Australian Open: Ruthless Jannik Sinner defends Australian Open crown to script historyAustralian Open 2025: World No.1 Jannik Sinner successfully defended his singles title after beating second seed Alexander Zverev 6-3, 7-6 (7-4), 6-3 in the grand finale on Sunday, January 26, at the Rod Laver Arena.

Saif Ali Khan's mediclaim approved over 'preferential treatment': Doctors' bodyThe Association of Medical Consultants (AMC) has expressed concerns regarding what it described as "preferential treatment" granted to actor Saif Ali Khan in the approval of his Rs 25 lakh medical insurance claim.

Impeached South Korean President Yoon indicted over short-lived martial lawSouth Korean prosecutors indicted President Yoon Suk Yeol on Sunday, accusing him of orchestrating an insurrection through his brief imposition of martial law on December 3.

Tamil predates sand, stone-age: Why India should embrace findings and dig deeperTamil Nadu's archaeology department recently released stunning evidence that Chief Minister MK Stalin said showed the Iron Age beginning there. Stalin lost no time in locating the new findings in the political context of the Aryan-versus-Dravidian debate. Regardless of who is on which side of these debates, it is time the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) ended its criminal neglect of an unfolding old civilisation. We need a massive national effort to unearth the secrets of this land. After all, Tamil Nadu is a part of India.

Disapproving marriage does not amount to abetment of suicide: Supreme CourtThe Supreme Court said that disapproving marriage does not amount to abetment of suicide under section 306 of the Indian Penal Code (IPC).

Arvind Kejriwal questions deploying Gujarat cops for his security, BJP respondsThe security arrangement for AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal, involving police personnel from two different states, was against the law, according to sources in the Delhi Police.

Twinkle Khanna on 'ridiculous rumours' about Kareena's absence during Saif's attackTwinkle Khanna has spoken out against the baseless rumours questioning Kareena Kapoor's absence during the attack on husband Saif Ali Khan. She called the speculations 'ridiculous' and unfounded.

Elon Musk tells Germans to move beyond past guilt at far-right party rallyElon Musk, despite facing backlash, once again endorsed Germany's far-right AfD party, calling it the nation's "best hope". His support sparked controversy, coinciding with mass anti-AfD protests across German cities.

Thalapathy Vijay's last film titled Jana Nayagan, first look outThalapathy Vijay's upcoming film, previously referred to as Thalapathy 69, now has an official title. The film has been named Jana Nayagan.

PR Sreejesh on Padma Bhushan honour: India has given me back more than what I gavePR Sreejesh expressed his happiness at being conferred with the Padma Bhushan award on Saturday, January 25. Sreejesh became the second hockey player to win the award.

Man claims Apple Watch nearly stolen at Delhi airport, shares details in viral postA Gurugram-based man alleged that his Apple Watch was almost stolen during a security check at Delhi airport's Terminal 3.

Trump's shocker to US tax officials, says he'll move new hires to Mexico borderTrump also suggested that IRS agents, some of whom are authorised to carry guns, would be a good fit at the US-Mexico border, where he has declared a national emergency to crack down on illegal immigration.

Pics: PM's turban to desi weapons, 76th Republic Day parade is a sight to beholdIndia marked its 76th Republic Day with a parade at Kartavya Path. The event showcased military equipment, including 125 mm smoothbore guns, 7.62 mm machine guns, 12.7 mm anti-aircraft guns, and tanks.  Agniban, a missile system, was also featured during the procession. Helicopters from the Indian Air Force carried the Indian and Indonesian flags over the venue.

From the India Today archives (2024) | Budget 2024-25: The book of jobsHow the first Budget of Modi government 3.0 had unveiled big initiatives for massive employment generation and skilling of the teeming young population

Billionaire friends shouldn't get tax money as loans: Arvind Kejriwal attacks BJPArvind Kejriwal said the people of Delhi would have to choose between two models, the BJP model that gives tax payers' money to billionaire friends as loans which are waived off later. And the second is the AAP model, which works only for the welfare of the citizens.

Viral video shows man squeezed between 2 buses in Tamil Nadu, escapes unharmedA video of a man's near-death experience went viral on social media. The video shows the moment when he was caught between two speeding buses.

Saif Ali Khan steps out with heavy security, son Ibrahim visits himActor Saif Ali Khan was clicked with his wife, actor Kareena Kapoor Khan, on Sunday under heavy security. In videos shared by paparazzi accounts, this marked his first public appearance after being discharged from the hospital.

PM Modi wears vibrant multicoloured turban for 76th Republic Day celebrationsRepublic Day 2025: The Prime Minister paired his turban with a white kurta-pyjama and a brown bandhgala jacket and pocket square for the Republic Day celebrations.

He suggested building housing elsewhere for Palestinians to live "in peace."

Aamir Khan celebrates 76th Republic Day at Statue of Unity in GujaratAamir Khan celebrated the 76th Republic Day in Gujarat, attending the festivities at the Statue of Unity. A video of the same was shared on social media.

sports.headline: I wasn't good enough: Alexander Zverev gracefully accepts defeat Australian Open 2025: World No.2 Alexander Zverev admitted that Jannik Sinner was the better player in the final at Rod Laver Arena. After two hours and 42 minutes, Sinner beat Zverev 6-3, 7-6 (4), 6-3.

Watch: Mary Kom, Suresh Raina take dip in Ganga at Maha Kumbh MelaMaha Kumbh: Legendary Indian boxer Mary Kom and former cricketer Suresh Raina took a dip at the Maha Kumbh. Mary Kom was seen enjoying her time in Ganga and even showed off her famous boxing stance.

Manchester United confirm Old Trafford regeneration project backed by governmentManchester United have confirmed that they will be getting support from the UK government for the Old Trafford regeneration project. United have welcomed the support and feel it could lead to a major redevelopment around the area in which Old Trafford is located at the moment.

Jofra was taken apart by Tilak Varma as the India batter went onto make a match-winning 72* on Saturday, January 25.

Namibia's Gerhard Erasmus crowned ICC Men's Associate Cricketer of the YearNamibia captain Gehrard Erasmus was crowned ICC Men's Associate Cricketer of the Year following his marvellous all-round performances in 2024.

Men's singles final Highlights: Sinner beats Zverev in straight setsAustralian Open 2025 mens singles final Highlights: Jannik Sinner beats Alexander Zverev in straight sets to win his second Australian Open title. Sinner beats Zverev 6-3, 7-6(4), 6-3 in the final in just 2 hours and 42 minutes.

Katerina Siniakova, Taylor Townsend crowned women's doubles championAustralian Open: Katerina Siniakova and Taylor Townsend won the women's doubles title at Melbourne Park after beating Jelena Ostapenko and Hsieh Su-wei 6-2, 6-7 (4), 6-3 on Sunday at the Rod Laver Arena.

Arteta proud of Arsenal handling chaotic red-card call to beat WolvesMikel Arteta lauded Arsenal's resilience after a 1-0 victory over Wolves, achieved despite Myles Lewis-Skelly's controversial first-half red card. Riccardo Calafiori's late winner highlighted the Gunners' mental toughness in a match clouded by VAR and officiating debates.

Watch: Pooran withdraws appeal against Tom Curran after controversial run-outMI Emirates skipper Nicholas Pooran withdrew his appeal against Gulf Giants' Tom Curran after the latter's controversial run out during Match 19 of ILT20.

Tilak Varma credits special training that led to his fiery T20I form Tilak Varma's short-ball training proved instrumental in India's thrilling victory over England in the second T20I, as his unbeaten 72 guided the team to a dramatic two-wicket win, solidifying his reputation as a rising star in Indian cricket.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
